messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] the 'samurai' films
messages.messageBody:
On Sep 20, 2004, at 8:28 AM, Kenshi Zey wrote:

>
> the thing i want to ask is, has anybody seen any of these films and
> would you recommend them?

Yes and, No...
-t

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] the 'samurai' films
messages.msgSnippet: yes!! i have seen those three films that you are talking about. i have copies of those. i highly recommend that you watch and collect those aforementioned
messages.messageBody:
yes!! i have seen those three films that you are talking about. i have copies of those. i highly recommend that you watch and collect those aforementioned films.



Kenshi Zey <paganelfshimmer@...> wrote:
greetings everyone!

i was going through this website that i download films from and i came across these 'samurai' films from 'the criterion collection', like: samurai I -musashi miyamoto ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0047444 ); samurai 2 - duel at ichijoji temple ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0048579 ); samurai III - duel at ganryu island ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0049710 ); samurai reincarnation ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0082699) and samurai champloo ( http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0423731/ ). the latter two are not from 'the criterion collection' i suppose.

the thing i want to ask is, has anybody seen any of these films and would you recommend them? perhaps not as a learning tool, yet to gain some visual insight into the life of the samurai. thanks in advance...


To sing under the moon and to dance in the first light of dawn...



"Like these blossoms,we all die..." ~ Katsumoto Moritsugu

If dying is so beautiful,then I wish I could die too...

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] the 'samurai' films
messages.msgSnippet: Samurai Champloo is an anime (cartoon). I ve watched the first two episodes and, well, it didn t really catch my attention all that much. It is historical,
messages.messageBody:
Samurai Champloo is an anime (cartoon). I've watched the first two
episodes and, well, it didn't really catch my attention all that much.
It is historical, though, so as a learning tool it could be useful.

messages.subject: the 'samurai' films
messages.msgSnippet: greetings everyone! i was going through this website that i download films from and i came across these samurai films from the criterion collection , like:
messages.messageBody:
greetings everyone!

i was going through this website that i download films from and i came across these 'samurai' films from 'the criterion collection', like: samurai I -musashi miyamoto ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0047444 ); samurai 2 - duel at ichijoji temple ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0048579 ); samurai III - duel at ganryu island ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0049710 ); samurai reincarnation ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0082699) and samurai champloo ( http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0423731/ ). the latter two are not from 'the criterion collection' i suppose.

the thing i want to ask is, has anybody seen any of these films and would you recommend them? perhaps not as a learning tool, yet to gain some visual insight into the life of the samurai. thanks in advance...
